headline: How the Narrative Surrounding Kimberly-Clark Is Shifting After the Planned Kenvue Acquisition
summary: Kimberly-Clark's latest valuation update reflects only a slight trim to its fair value estimate, nudging it from about $128.87 to $127.73 per share, even as assumptions for long term revenue growth climb from roughly 7.0% to around 10.4%. With the discount rate effectively steady near 6.956%, the shift in price target appears driven more by caution over Kenvue related execution risk than by any loss of confidence in the company’s growth outlook. Read on to see how you can track these evolving...
